00022 /**
00023  * @class   mas5Stat
00024  * @brief  ChipStream and AnalysisStream compatible implementation
00025  * of the MAS 5.0 statistical algorithms.
00026  *
00027  * An implementation of the methods described in Affymetrix
00028  * Technical Notes "Fine Tuning Your Data Analysis" (2001),
00029  * "New Statistical Algorithms for Monitoring Gene Expression
00030  * on GeneChip® Probe Arrays" (2001), "Statistical Algorithms
00031  * Reference Guide." (2001), and in "Robust estimators for
00032  * expression analysis", E. Hubbell, W.-m. Liu and R. Mei,
00033  * Bioinformatics 2002 18:1585-1592, and "Analysis of high
00034  * density expression microarrays with signed-rank call algorithms",
00035  * W.-m. Liu, R. Mei, X. Di, T.B. Ryder, E. Hubbell, S. Dee,
00036  * T.A. Webster, C.A. Harrington, M.-h. Ho, J. Baid and
00037  * S.P. Smeekens, Bioinformatics 2002 18:1593-1599.
00038  *
00039  * This is based on the implementation in class
00040  * CExpressionAlgorithmImplementation.
00041  *
00042  * This class provides ChipStream compatible background
00043  * correction and AnalysisStream compatible detection
00044  * of expressed genes and signal estimation.
00045  *
00046  * Detection calls use discrimination scores based on
00047  * Wilcoxon's signed-rank test.  P-values are calculated,
00048  * giving a confidence level for the pertinent hypothesis.
00049  * Probe sets for which the p-value for expression is below
00050  * the Alpha1 threshold are called present, those with
00051  * p-value above the Alpha2 threshold are called absent,
00052  * and those with p-value between Alpha1 and Alpha2 are
00053  * called marginal.
00054  *
00055  * In background correction, the microarray is divided
00056  * into N x N zones (default N = 4); the background in
00057  * a zone is the average of the lowest 2% of probe set cell
00058  * intensities within that zone, using a smoothing
00059  * method to avoid the discontinuity of background
00060  * on the boundary of zones.
00061  */
00062 
00063 #ifndef _MAS5STAT_H_
00064 #define _MAS5STAT_H_

00078 #define EXP_MARGINAL_CALL_TYPE 1
00079 #define EXP_ABSENT_CALL_TYPE   2
00080 #define EXP_NO_ABS_CALL_TYPE   3

00118   _CSAbsStatExpressionProbeSetResultType *operator=(_CSAbsStatExpressionProbeSetResultType &src)

00125 /////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00126 // Template Functions
00127 /////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00128 template<class T> ExpResults oneSidedSignRank2 (const vector<T> & x, const double alpha)
00129 {
00130   const int len = (int) x.size();
00131   // 1. Ignore all zero differences.
00132   vector <T> newdiff = x;
00133   int n = 0;
00134   int i;
00135   for (i = 0; i < len; ++i)
00136     if (x[i] != 0.0)
00137     {
00138       newdiff[n] = x[i];
00139       ++n;
00140     }
00141   if (n == 0) // No non-zero differences.  Output 0.5 as the one-sided p-value and detection is absent.
00142     return ExpResults (0.5, 0);
00143   newdiff.resize (n);
00144 
00145   // 2.  Assign integer ranks to the differences.
00146   vector<T> ranks (n);
00147   for (i = 0; i < n; ++i)
00148     ranks[i] = (float)(i + 1);
00149 
00150   // 3. Convert differences to absolute values and sort in ascending order.
00151   vector <struct ExpResults> absdiff (n);
00152   for (i = 0; i < n; ++i)
00153   {
00154     absdiff[i].p_value = fabs (newdiff[i]);
00155     absdiff[i].call = i;
00156   }
00157   sort (absdiff.begin(), absdiff.end());
00158 
00159   // 4. If there are ties among absolute differences, all differences in a tie
00160   //    group are assigned to a rank equal to the average of the integer ranks.
00161   int nTies = 0;
00162 
00163   // Avoid cross-platform compatibility problems from approximate floating point arithmetic.
00164   const double tiny = 2e-09;
00165   for (i = 0; i < n - 1; ++i)
00166     if (fabs (absdiff[i].p_value - absdiff[i+1].p_value) < tiny)
00167     {
00168       nTies ++;
00169       break;
00170     }
00171 
00172   int tieGroup = 0;
00173   double doubleVarMod = 0; // modification of variance due to ties.
00174   if (nTies)
00175   {
00176     i = 0;
00177     while ( i < n - 1)
00178     {
00179       const double initElement = absdiff[i].p_value;
00180       int tieGroupSize = 1;
00181       for (int j = i + 1; j < n; ++j)
00182       {
00183         if (fabs (absdiff[j].p_value - initElement) < tiny)
00184         {
00185           tieGroupSize ++;
00186           if (j == n - 1)
00187           {
00188             i = j;
00189             tieGroup ++;
00190             for (int m = j - tieGroupSize + 1; m <= j; ++m)
00191               ranks[m] = (2*j - tieGroupSize + 3) / 2.0f;
00192             doubleVarMod += tieGroupSize *
00193               ((double)tieGroupSize * tieGroupSize - 1);
00194             break;
00195           }
00196         }
00197         else
00198         {
00199           i = j;
00200           if (tieGroupSize > 1)
00201           {
00202             tieGroup ++;
00203             for (int m = j - tieGroupSize; m <= j - 1; ++m)
00204               ranks[m] = (2 * j - tieGroupSize + 1) / 2.0f;
00205             doubleVarMod += tieGroupSize *
00206               ((double)tieGroupSize * tieGroupSize - 1);
00207           }
00208           break;
00209         }
00210       }
00211     }
00212   }
00213   vector <T> invr (n);
00214   for (i = 0; i < n; ++i)
00215     invr[absdiff[i].call] = ranks[i];
00216 
00217   double w = 0;
00218   for (i = 0; i < n; ++i)
00219     if (newdiff[i] > 0)
00220       w += invr[i];
00221 
00222   struct ExpResults ans;
00223   if (n > 11)
00224   {
00225     // Use the asymptotic approximation:
00226     // S' = [S - n (n+1)/4]/sqrt[n(n+1)(2n+1)/24 - c]
00227     // where S is the sum of all positive signed ranks
00228     // and c = sum (b(b*b - 1)/48 is the modification of variance due to ties.
00229     //
00230     // p-value = 1 - f (S')
00231     // where f (S') is the cumulative distribution function of
00232     // standard normal distribution.
00233     double dw = w - ((double) n) * (n + 1) / 4.0;
00234     double denom2 = (((double)n)*(n+1)*(2*n+1) - 0.5*doubleVarMod)/24.0;
00235     if (denom2 <=0)
00236       return ExpResults (0, 0);
00237 
00238     double z = dw / sqrt (denom2);
00239     ans.p_value = 1 - normalCDF(z);
00240   }
00241   else
00242   {
00243     if (nTies == 0)
00244     {
00245       int iCode = 0;
00246       for (i=0; i < n; ++i)
00247         if (newdiff[i] > 0)
00248           iCode += 1 << ((int) invr[i] - 1);
00249       ans.p_value = fGetPValue (n-1, iCode);
00250     }
00251     else
00252     {
00253       int twoToN = 1 << n;
00254       vector<int> mask (n);
00255       for (i = 0; i < n; ++i)
00256         mask[i] = 1 << i;
00257       vector <int> posRanks (twoToN);
00258       for (i = 0; i < twoToN; ++i)
00259       {
00260         double sum = 0;
00261         for (int j = 0; j < n; ++j)
00262           if (i & mask[j])
00263             sum += ranks[j];
00264         posRanks[i] = (int) sum;
00265       }
00266       double tail = 0;
00267       for (i = 0; i < twoToN; ++i)
00268       {
00269         if (posRanks[i] > w)
00270           tail ++;
00271         else if (posRanks[i] == w)
00272           tail += 0.5;
00273       }
00274       ans.p_value = tail / (double) twoToN;
00275     }
00276   }
00277   ans.call = (ans.p_value < alpha) ? 1 : 0;
00278   return ans;
00279 }
00280 
00281 //////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00282 
00283 /**
00284  * @brief Calculate trimmed mean and standard deviation.
00285  *
00286  * @param v Vector of data.
00287  * @param p1 Low threshold (unused).
00288  * @param p2 High threshold.
00289  * @return FloatPair Mean, Standard deviation.
00290  */
00291 template <class T> FloatPair trimMeanAndStd (vector<T> & v, const double p1, const double p2) {
00292   int total = (int) v.size();
00293   FloatPair fp (0, 0);
00294   if (total > 0)
00295   {
00296     sort (v.begin(), v.end());
00297     int n1 = 0;
00298     int n2 = (int)floor (total * p2);
00299     double subtotal = n2;
00300     if (subtotal >= 2)
00301     {
00302       double sum = 0;
00303       for (int i = n1; i < n2; ++i)
00304         sum += v[i];
00305       double tMean = sum / subtotal;
00306 
00307       sum = 0;
00308       for (int i = n1; i < n2; ++i)
00309         sum += pow (v[i] - tMean, 2);
00310 
00311       fp.value1 = (float) tMean;
00312       fp.value2 = (float) sqrt (sum / (subtotal - 1));
00313     }
00314     else if (subtotal == 1)
00315       fp.value1 = v[n1];
00316   }
00317   return fp;
00318 }
00319 
00320 //////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00321 
00322 /**
00323  * @brief Calculate median.
00324  *
00325  * @param x Vector of data.
00326  * @return Float result.
00327  */
00328 template<class T> float median(const vector<T> & v) {
00329   vector <T> u = v;
00330   int len = (int) u.size();
00331   if (len < 1)
00332     return -1;
00333 
00334   sort(u.begin(), u.end());
00335   int half = len / 2;
00336   if (len % 2 == 1)
00337     return (float)u[half];
00338 
00339   else
00340     return ((float)u[half - 1] + (float)u[half]) / 2.0;
00341 
00342 }
00343 
00344 //////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00345 
00346 /**
00347  * @brief Calculate median absolute deviation.
00348  *
00349  * @param x Vector of data.
00350  * @return Float result.
00351  */
00352 template<class T> float medianAbsoluteDeviation (const vector<T> & x)
00353 {
00354   const float medianValue = median (x);
00355   const int size = (int) x.size();
00356   vector<T> v (size);
00357   for (int i = 0; i < size;i++)
00358     v[i] = fabs (x[i] - medianValue);
00359 
00360   return median (v);
00361 }
00362 
00363 //////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00364 
00365 /**
00366  * @brief Calculate sign rank from differences.
00367  *
00368  * @param dif Vector of differences.
00369  * @param alpha1 Threshold for present call.
00370  * @param alpha2 Threshold for absent call.
00371  * @return ExpResults p_value, call.
00372  */
00373 template<class T> ExpResults newSignRank (const vector<T> & dif,
00374   const double alpha1, const double alpha2)
00375 {
00376   struct ExpResults newPH;
00377   struct ExpResults oldPH = oneSidedSignRank2 (dif, alpha1);
00378 
00379   newPH.p_value = oldPH.p_value;
00380   if (oldPH.call == 1)
00381     newPH.call = 2;
00382   else if (oldPH.p_value < alpha2)
00383     newPH.call = 1;
00384   else if (oldPH.p_value > 1 - alpha1)
00385     newPH.call = -2;
00386   else if (oldPH.p_value > 1 - alpha2)
00387     newPH.call = -1;
00388   else
00389     newPH.call = 0;
00390 
00391   return newPH;
00392 }

00394 /**
00395  *  mas5Stat
00396  *  @brief Object for the MAS 5.0 statistical algorithm.
00397  *
00398  */
00399 class mas5Stat
00400 {
00401 public:
00402 
00403   /** Constructor.
00404    * @param param Map of key/value pairs to set user-defined parameters.
00405    */
00406   mas5Stat (std::map<std::string,std::string>& param);
00407 
00408   /** Destructor.
00409    */
00410   ~mas5Stat();
00411 
00412   /**
00413    * @brief Set layout (cdf or pgf/clf combination) specific
00414    * parameters.
00415    *
00416    * @param cols Number of feature columns in the array.
00417    * @param rows Number of feature rows in the array.
00418    * @param maskedProbes Map describing probes to ignore.
00419    */
00420   void setLayoutParams (int cols, int rows, const std::map<probeid_t, bool>& maskedProbes,
00421                         const int probeSetCount, ChipLayout &layout);
00422 
00423   /**
00424    * @brief Compute background intensity, noise for each zone.
00425    *
00426    * @param data Chip data as vector<float>.
00427    * @param chipsWithBackgroundCount Count of chips for which background
00428    *        has been calculated.
00429    */
00430   void computeBackground (const std::vector<float>& data, const int chipsWithBackgroundCount);
00431 
00432   /**
00433    * @brief Compute background adjusted intensity.
00434    *
00435    * @param probeIx Probe index from the cel file.
00436    * @param chipIx Microarray index.
00437    * @param intensity Original intensity.
00438    *
00439    * @return float Adjusted intensity.
00440    */
00441   float computeBGAdjustedIntensity (const int probeIx, const int chipIx, const float intensity);
00442 
00443   /**
00444    * @brief Compute detection p-values.
00445    *
00446    * @param pmI Vector of perfect match intensities.
00447    * @param mmI Vector of mismatch intensities.
00448    * @param pmIndex Vector of perfect match probe ids.
00449    * @param mmIndex Vector of mismatch probe ids.
00450    * @param pValue P-value for detection (output).
00451    * @param call Expression call (output).
00452    * @param pairs Probe pairs (output).
00453    * @param pairsUsed Probe pairs used (output).
00454    */
00455   void computeExpressionStat (const std::vector<float>& pmI, const std::vector<float>& mmI,
00456                               const std::vector<probeid_t>& pmId, const std::vector<probeid_t>& mmId,
00457                               double& pValue, unsigned char& call, int& pairs, int& pairsUsed);
00458 
00459   /**
00460    * @brief Compute average measurement.
00461    *
00462    * @param pmI Vector of perfect match intensities.
00463    * @param mmI Vector of mismatch intensities.
00464    * @param pmIndex Vector of perfect match probe ids.
00465    * @param mmIndex Vector of mismatch probe ids.
00466    * @param avgMeasurement Average measurement (output).
00467    */
00468   void computeMeasurement (const std::vector<float>& pmI, const std::vector<float>& mmI,
00469                            const std::vector<probeid_t>& pmId, const std::vector<probeid_t>& mmId,
00470                            double& avgMeasurement);
00471 
00472   /**
00473    * @brief Set saturated intensity parameter.
00474    *
00475    * This is to be used for testing only.
00476    *
00477    * @param saturatedIntensity Saturated intensity.
00478    */
00479   void setSaturatedIntensity (const float& saturatedIntensity)
00480   {
00481     m_Params.SaturatedIntensity = saturatedIntensity;
00482   }
00483 
00484   /**
00485    * @brief Clear data.
00486    *
00487    */
00488   void Clear();
00489 
00490 private:
00491 
00492   /**
00493    * @brief Convert user defined parameters, set the corresponding
00494    * class parameters.
00495    *
00496    * @param param Map of user-defined key/value pairs.
00497    */
00498   void convertParams (const std::map<std::string,std::string>& param);
00499 
00500   /**
00501    * @brief Determine if the probe with the given coordinates is masked.
00502    *
00503    * Currently disabled - always returns false.
00504    *
00505    * @param col Column.
00506    * @param row Row.
00507    * @return True if masked, else false.
00508    */
00509   inline bool isMasked (const int col, const int row)
00510   {
00511 #ifdef SUPPORT_MAS5_PROBE_MASKING
00512     return m_MaskedProbes.find (colRowToIndex (col,row)) != m_MaskedProbesEnd;
00513 #else
00514     return false;
00515 #endif
00516   }
00517 
00518   /**
00519    * @brief Convert column, row (x, y) to index.
00520    *
00521    * Follow CCELFileData::XYToIndex.
00522    *
00523    * @param col Column.
00524    * @param row Row.
00525    * @return int Index.
00526    */
00527   inline int colRowToIndex (const int col, const int row)
00528   {
00529     return row * m_Cols + col;
00530   }
00531 
00532   /**
00533    * @brief Get X coordinate from index.
00534    *
00535    * Follow CCELFileData::IndexToX().
00536    *
00537    * @param index Index.
00538    * @return int X coordinate.
00539    */
00540   inline int indexToX (const int index)
00541   {
00542     return index % m_Cols;
00543   }
00544 
00545   /**
00546    * @brief Get Y coordinate from index.
00547    *
00548    * Follow CCELFileData::IndexToY().
00549    *
00550    * @param index Index.
00551    * @return int Y coordinate.
00552    */
00553   inline int indexToY (const int index)
00554   {
00555     return index / m_Cols;
00556   }
00557 
00558   /**
00559    * @brief Find zone index from the cell x, y coordinates.
00560    *
00561    * @param cellx Cell x coordinate (column).
00562    * @param celly Cell y coordinate (row).
00563    * @return int Zone.
00564    */
00565   int DetermineZone (const int cellx, const int celly)
00566   {
00567     const float fZx = (float) cellx / m_ZoneXF;
00568     const float fZy = (float) celly / m_ZoneYF;
00569 
00570     const int Zx = (int) floor (fZx);
00571     const int Zy = (int) floor (fZy);
00572 
00573     const int zoneID = Zx + Zy * m_Params.NumberVertZones;
00574     return zoneID;
00575   }
00576 
00577   /**
00578    * @brief Set minimum intensity to Epsilon.
00579    *
00580    * @param intensity Intensity.
00581    * @return float Modified intensity.
00582    */
00583   inline float modifyIntensitySlightly (const float& intensity)
00584   {
00585     return max (intensity, m_Params.Epsilon);
00586   }
00587 
00588   /**
00589    * @brief Adjust intensity based on background and noise.
00590    *
00591    * @param intensity Intensity.
00592    * @param background Background.
00593    * @param noise Noise.
00594    * @return float Modified intensity.
00595    */
00596   inline float computeAdjustedIntensity (const float& intensity, const float& background, const float& noise)
00597   {
00598     const float factoredNoise = noise * m_Params.NoiseFrac;
00599     const float diff = intensity - background;
00600     return max (max(diff, factoredNoise), 0.5f);
00601     // AlexC - 1/22/01
00602     // Code Comments:
00603     // if too frequent substitution of the noise value, alert might generated.
00604     // Refer to the page 4 of the Background and Spatial Variation Adjustement spec.,
00605     // under eq (16), it said that
00606     // "Production software should probably alert the user if the noise value is being
00607     //  substituted too frequently (indicating that too much data is below the noise level),
00608     //  but an appropriate threshold value is not at present known."
00609   }
00610 
00611   /**
00612    * @brief Compute weight at x, y coordinates based on the
00613    * distance from center x and y coordinates.
00614    *
00615    * @param x X coordinate.
00616    * @param y Y coordinate.
00617    * @param centerX Center X coordinate.
00618    * @param centerY Center Y coordinate.
00619    * @param smoothFactor Smoothing factor.
00620    * @return float Weight.
00621    */
00622   inline float computeWeightAtXY (const float& x, const float& y, const float& centerX,
00623       const float& centerY, const float& smoothFactor)
00624   {
00625     return 1.0f / (computeSquaredDistance (x , y, centerX, centerY) + smoothFactor);
00626   }
00627 
00628   /**
00629    * @brief Compute squared distance between (x1,y1) and (x2,y2).
00630    *
00631    * @param x1 X1 coordinate.
00632    * @param y1 Y1 coordinate.
00633    * @param x2 X2 coordinate.
00634    * @param y2 Y2 coordinate.
00635    * @return float Distance.
00636    */
00637   inline float computeSquaredDistance (const float& x1, const float& y1, const float& x2, const float& y2)
00638   {
00639     const float diffx = x1 - x2;
00640     const float diffy = y1 - y2;
00641     return diffx * diffx + diffy * diffy;
00642   }
00643 
00644   /**
00645    * @brief Compute the absolute call.
00646    *
00647    * @param unit Absolute result.
00648    * @param result Result.
00649    */
00650   inline void ComputeAbsoluteCall (CSAbsStatExpressionProbeSetResultType *unit, ExpResults *res)
00651   {
00652     // Determine if the gene is present.
00653     if ( res->call == 2)
00654       unit->Detection = EXP_PRESENT_CALL_TYPE;
00655 
00656     // Determine if marginal
00657     else if ( res->call == 1)
00658       unit->Detection = EXP_MARGINAL_CALL_TYPE;
00659 
00660     // Otherwise the gene is absent.
00661     else
00662       unit->Detection = EXP_ABSENT_CALL_TYPE;
00663   }
00664 
00665   /**
00666    * @brief Compute contrast value.
00667    *
00668    * @param pmI Perfect match intensities.
00669    * @param mmI Mismatch intensities.
00670    * @param CT Contrast value (output).
00671    */
00672   void ComputeContrastValue (const vector<float>& pmI, const vector<float>& mmI, vector<float>& CT);
00673 
00674   /**
00675    * @brief Compute probe value.
00676    *
00677    * @param pmI Perfect match intensities.
00678    * @param CT Contrast value.
00679    * @param PV Probe value (output).
00680    */
00681   void ComputeProbeValue (const vector<float>& pmI, const vector<float>& CT, vector<float>& PV);
00682 
00683   /**
00684    * @brief Compute typical difference.
00685    *
00686    * @param pmI Perfect match intensities.
00687    * @param mmI Mismatch intensities.
00688    * @param SB Step biweight (output).
00689    */
00690   void ComputeTypicalDifference (const vector<float>& pmI, const vector<float>& mmI, float& SB);
00691 
00692   /**
00693    * @brief Compute logarithm to the base two.
00694    *
00695    * @param value Value to compute logarithm of.
00696    * @return double Logarithm to the base two.
00697    */
00698   inline const double logtwo (const double value)
00699   {
00700     return (log (value) / log_2);
00701   }
00702 
00703   /**
00704    * @brief Compute the inverse of the logarithm
00705    * (exponent) to the base two.
00706    *
00707    * @param value Value to compute exponent of.
00708    * @return double Exponent to the base two.
00709    */
00710   inline const double antiLog (const double value)
00711   {
00712     return pow (2.0, value);
00713   }
00714 
00715   /**
00716    * @brief Compute one-step biweight estimate.
00717    *
00718    * @param x Vector of log differences.
00719    * @param c Tuning constant.
00720    * @param epsilon Epsilon.
00721    * @return float Estimate.
00722    */
00723   float OneStepBiweightAlgorithm (const vector<float>& x, const float& c, const float& epsilon);
00724 
00725   /**
00726    * @brief Compute used set
00727    *
00728    * @param InputSet Input set.
00729    * @param pmId Perfect match probe ids.
00730    * @param mmId Mismatch probe ids.
00731    * @return vector<float> UsedSet Used set (output).
00732    */
00733   void GetUsedSet (const vector<float>& InputSet, vector<float>& UsedSet,
00734                    const vector<probeid_t>& pmId, const vector<probeid_t>& mmId);
00735 
00736   /// private data
00737   /// parameters
00738   CExpStatAlgSettings m_Params;
00739   /// number of feature columns
00740   int m_Cols;
00741   /// number of feature rows
00742   int m_Rows;
00743   /// number of probesets
00744   int m_ProbeSetCount;
00745   /// Bitmask where true indicates that probes are present in a probeset
00746   std::vector<bool> m_ProbesetProbes;
00747   /// number of columns of features per zone
00748   int m_ZoneX;
00749   /// number of rows of features per zone
00750   int m_ZoneY;
00751   /// number of columns of features per zone (float)
00752   float m_ZoneXF;
00753   /// number of rows of features per zone (float)
00754   float m_ZoneYF;
00755   /// count of chips with background calculated
00756   int m_ChipsWithBackground;
00757   /// vector of info for all zones
00758   std::vector<CSAllZonesInfoType*> m_VecZonesInfo;
00759   /// masked probes
00760   std::map<probeid_t, bool> m_MaskedProbes;
00761   /// end of masked probes
00762   std::map<probeid_t, bool>::const_iterator m_MaskedProbesEnd;
00763   /// total number of zones
00764   int m_NumberZones;
00765   /// logarithm of two
00766   const double log_2;
00767 
00768 };
